answers.answer: Both your T3 and T4 tests look like total T3 and T4 to me.  If your lab report doesn't specifically say that these are "frees", then they're total.  Unfortunately, TT3 and TT4 are considered obsolete tests and have been replaced by FT3 and FT4, which tell how much of each of these hormones is available to your cells.  Your results for T3 and T4 are quite high in their ranges (T3 is actually above range).  It's probably time for some further testing, especially TSI to confirm or rule out Grave's.  At the same time, I'd have FT3 and FT4 run.
Thanks very much for your comment. I'm supposed to see a specialist tomorrow and will ask him about what you told me. This is just all new to me. Thanks again.
Sometimes the Metformin can give false results as it interferes with the thyroid levels and the Pancreas.Have you been tested for Diabetes at all?
Thanks for your information on the metformin will tell the dr. Yes I have been tested for diabetes and I don't have it. Now getting my FT3 and FT4 tested together with my TSH again.
Good stuff and great to hear Diabetes was ruled out.There are alternative medications that do the same as Metformin.Ask your Doc.

question: Hi, my test results areName if test                        Results                               Reference RangeT3 (Triiodothyronine)            213.8                                  Euthyroid: 80 - 200 ng/dlT4 (Thyroxine)                     11.37                                  4.6 - 12.0 ug/dlTSH                                    0.686                                 0.2 - 4.2 ulU/ml (AACE TSH range of 0.3 - 3.0)This seems normal to me but I'm getting a lot of symptoms mostly tiredness and perspiring in Air condition sometimes, weight gain among others, but i also have PCOS and I'm on metformin 500mg. What does this mean?Thanks
title: Help me with these results
